title: The Roman Senate declares Vespasian emperor of Rome, the last in the Year of the Four Emperors.
text: • AD 69 – The Roman Senate declares Vespasian emperor of Rome, the last in the Year of the Four Emperors.

title: Pope Honorius II is elected.
text: • 1124 – Pope Honorius II is elected.

title: Conrad III of Germany besieges Weinsberg.
text: • 1140 – Conrad III of Germany besieges Weinsberg.

title: The city of Ryazan is sacked by the Mongol army of Batu Khan.
text: • 1237 – The city of Ryazan is sacked by the Mongol army of Batu Khan.

title: The Battle of Linuesa is fought in the context of the Spanish Reconquista between the forces of the Emirate of Granada and the combined army of the Kingdom of Castile and of Jaén resulting in a Castilian victory.
text: • 1361 – The Battle of Linuesa is fought in the context of the Spanish Reconquista between the forces of the Emirate of Granada and the combined army of the Kingdom of Castile and of Jaén resulting in a Castilian victory.

title: Battle of Curalaba: The revolting Mapuche, led by cacique Pelentaru, inflict a major defeat on Spanish troops in southern Chile.
text: • 1598 – Battle of Curalaba: The revolting Mapuche, led by cacique Pelentaru, inflict a major defeat on Spanish troops in southern Chile.

title: Plymouth Colony: William Bradford and the Mayflower Pilgrims land on what is now known as Plymouth Rock in Plymouth, Massachusetts.
text: • 1620 – Plymouth Colony: William Bradford and the Mayflower Pilgrims land on what is now known as Plymouth Rock in Plymouth, Massachusetts.

title: American settlers in Nacogdoches, Mexican Texas, declare their independence, starting the Fredonian Rebellion.
text: • 1826 – American settlers in Nacogdoches, Mexican Texas, declare their independence, starting the Fredonian Rebellion.

title: Egyptian
text: • 1832 – Egyptian–Ottoman War: Egyptian forces decisively defeat Ottoman troops at the Battle of Konya.

title: The Rochdale Society of Equitable Pioneers commences business at its cooperative in Rochdale, England, starting the Cooperative movement.
text: • 1844 – The Rochdale Society of Equitable Pioneers commences business at its cooperative in Rochdale, England, starting the Cooperative movement.

title: Medal of Honor: Public Resolution 82, containing a provision for a Navy Medal of Valor, is signed into law by President Abraham Lincoln.
text: • 1861 – Medal of Honor: Public Resolution 82, containing a provision for a Navy Medal of Valor, is signed into law by President Abraham Lincoln.

title: Challenger expedition: HMS Challenger, commanded by Captain George Nares, sails from Portsmouth, England.
text: • 1872 – Challenger expedition: HMS Challenger, commanded by Captain George Nares, sails from Portsmouth, England.

title: World premiere of Henrik Ibsen's A Doll's House at the Royal Theatre in Copenhagen, Denmark.
text: • 1879 – World premiere of Henrik Ibsen's A Doll's House at the Royal Theatre in Copenhagen, Denmark.

title: The Royal Canadian Dragoons and The Royal Canadian Regiment, the first Permanent Force cavalry and infantry regiments of the Canadian Army, are formed.
text: • 1883 – The Royal Canadian Dragoons and The Royal Canadian Regiment, the first Permanent Force cavalry and infantry regiments of the Canadian Army, are formed.

title: The Chilean Army commits a massacre of at least 2,000 striking saltpeter miners in Iquique, Chile.
text: • 1907 – The Chilean Army commits a massacre of at least 2,000 striking saltpeter miners in Iquique, Chile.

title: An underground explosion at the Hulton Bank Colliery No. 3 Pit in Over Hulton, Westhoughton, England, kills 344 miners.
text: • 1910 – An underground explosion at the Hulton Bank Colliery No. 3 Pit in Over Hulton, Westhoughton, England, kills 344 miners.

title: Arthur Wynne's "word
text: • 1913 – Arthur Wynne's "word-cross", the first crossword puzzle, is published in the New York World.

title: American anarchist Emma Goldman is deported to Russia.
text: • 1919 – American anarchist Emma Goldman is deported to Russia.

title: United Kingdom and Nepal formally signed an agreement of friendship, called the Nepal
text: • 1923 – United Kingdom and Nepal formally signed an agreement of friendship, called the Nepal–Britain Treaty of 1923, which superseded the Treaty of Sugauli signed in 1816.

title: First flight of the Junkers Ju 88 multi
text: • 1936 – First flight of the Junkers Ju 88 multi-role combat aircraft.

title: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs, the world's first full
text: • 1937 – Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs, the world's first full-length animated feature, premieres at the Carthay Circle Theatre.

title: World War II: A formal treaty of alliance between Thailand and Japan is signed in the presence of the Emerald Buddha in Wat Phra Kaew, Thailand.
text: • 1941 – World War II: A formal treaty of alliance between Thailand and Japan is signed in the presence of the Emerald Buddha in Wat Phra Kaew, Thailand.

title: An 8.1 Mw earthquake and subsequent tsunami in Nankaidō, Japan, kills over 1,300 people and destroys over 38,000 homes.
text: • 1946 – An 8.1 Mw earthquake and subsequent tsunami in Nankaidō, Japan, kills over 1,300 people and destroys over 38,000 homes.

title: "Bloody Christmas" begins in Cyprus, ultimately resulting in the displacement of 25,000
text: • 1963 – "Bloody Christmas" begins in Cyprus, ultimately resulting in the displacement of 25,000-30,000 Turkish Cypriots and destruction of more than 100 villages.

title: International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination is adopted.
text: • 1965 – International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination is adopted.

title: Louis Washkansky, the first man to undergo a human
text: • 1967 – Louis Washkansky, the first man to undergo a human-to-human heart transplant, dies in Cape Town, South Africa, having lived for 18 days after the transplant.

title: Apollo program: Apollo 8 is launched from the Kennedy Space Center, placing its crew on a lunar trajectory for the first visit to another celestial body by humans.
text: • 1968 – Apollo program: Apollo 8 is launched from the Kennedy Space Center, placing its crew on a lunar trajectory for the first visit to another celestial body by humans.

title: First flight of F
text: • 1970 – First flight of F-14 multi-role combat aircraft.

title: The Geneva Conference on the Arab
text: • 1973 – The Geneva Conference on the Arab–Israeli conflict opens.

title: Lancaster House Agreement: An independence agreement for Rhodesia is signed in London by Lord Carrington, Sir Ian Gilmour, Robert Mugabe, Joshua Nkomo, Bishop Abel Muzorewa and S.C. Mundawarara.
text: • 1979 – Lancaster House Agreement: An independence agreement for Rhodesia is signed in London by Lord Carrington, Sir Ian Gilmour, Robert Mugabe, Joshua Nkomo, Bishop Abel Muzorewa and S.C. Mundawarara.

title: A bomb explodes on board Pan Am Flight 103 over Lockerbie, Dumfries and Galloway, Scotland, killing 270. This is to date the deadliest air disaster to occur in British soil.
text: • 1988 – A bomb explodes on board Pan Am Flight 103 over Lockerbie, Dumfries and Galloway, Scotland, killing 270. This is to date the deadliest air disaster to occur in British soil.

title: The first flight of Antonov An
text: • 1988 – The first flight of Antonov An-225 Mriya, the largest aircraft in the world.

title: A Dutch DC
text: • 1992 – A Dutch DC-10, flight Martinair MP 495, crashes at Faro Airport, killing 56.

title: The city of Bethlehem passes from Israeli to Palestinian control.
text: • 1995 – The city of Bethlehem passes from Israeli to Palestinian control.

title: The Spanish Civil Guard intercepts a van loaded with 950 kg of explosives that ETA intended to use to blow up Torre Picasso in Madrid, Spain.
text: • 1999 – The Spanish Civil Guard intercepts a van loaded with 950 kg of explosives that ETA intended to use to blow up Torre Picasso in Madrid, Spain.

title: Iraq War: A suicide bomber killed 22 at the forward operating base next to the main U.S. military airfield at Mosul, Iraq, the single deadliest suicide attack on American soldiers.
text: • 2004 – Iraq War: A suicide bomber killed 22 at the forward operating base next to the main U.S. military airfield at Mosul, Iraq, the single deadliest suicide attack on American soldiers.

title: 2012 phenomenon: This day was regarded as the end
text: • 2012 – 2012 phenomenon: This day was regarded as the end-date of a 5,126-year-long cycle in the Mesoamerican Long Count calendar, leading to widespread expectations of cataclysmic event.
